sorry , my humor was not understood, and you are right about the shinsa, but i keep saying that it is japanese but not made the traditional way.
it is a tourist item and most of the time there is something like a hamon and some jihada is also often seen.
they are less then the showa stamp blades.
but thank you for your answer, by yourself because i think this hole group jumpt on me for this mispaced joke.

christophe
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: ROBSON Gordon 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, November 30, 2008 2:47 AM
  Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Question about a small Tanto or??


  The position of the mekugi ana and its shape are not of Japanese origins. I don't 
  need to read more books. As a member of the NTHK's shinsa team here in Tokyo 
  and a director of the NTHK, I would say that I am in a bit better position to know. If 
  that sword were submitted for shinsa, it would fail as not being Japanese.

  Gordon
